Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunilR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel apartment for almost 10 days...initial few days in 1 bed room apartment and then in 2 bed room apartment due to year end rush...Hotel is good and spacious...service levels are good...staff is helpful and courteous....This hotel is now called Tulip Creek Hotel apartments...there is a 24 hours super market called "Circle K" almost next door with Hyper market "Day to Day" 2 minutes walk and Deira City Centre and Metro 3 minutes walk....Thus location is perfect with great apartment and courteous and helpful staff...Now let us come to negatives.....Even after paying so much for room internet is chargeable in room (complimentary WIFI in lobby and restaurant though) and wired....Also I felt internet charges are quite high....Food in the restaurant is nothing great and can be avoided....free complimentary breakfast was also a challenge for us for lack of choices....If hotel administration is able to overcome these two negatives then it would be a nice. Overall a very good experience and would recommend this property to others...

Reviews.Title: “New name for hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaydee231
Reviews.Content: The Star Boutique is now called Tulip Creek Apartment Hotel and is under new management. Stayed this time in a two bed apartment which is very spacious and has four bathroom areas. Same size balcony as one bed apartment. Unfortunately all the two bed units are on the side rather than the front of the hotel and therefore do not really get much sun on the balcony. Ideal if you do not want the facilities of an actual hotel. Breakfast is average but sufficient. The front desk staff are very helpful and the young manager quickly sorted out minor difficulties with the lack of hot water. It is a short walk to the Dubai City Centre metro station and a couple of minutes more to the City Centre Mall. Small supermarket close by for water and snacks. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingteacher78
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio room, which we found to be of ample size for two adults and one child. The rooms are really nicely decorated, clean and come with a well equipped kitchen complete with full-size fridge (great for keeping your beers chilled - NB you will need to buy alcohol in bulk at the airport when you arrive in Dubai as the shops don't sell it).The bathroom is immense - huge by hotel standards, tastefully decorated and with nice quality complimentary toiletries! From the window of the apartment we had a pleasant view of the city. The hotel is very close to the Deira shopping centre, though there is not much else in the area to do, and we found ourselves regularly using taxis to get to places we wanted to see. That said the taxis were very cheap, the slightly poor location of the hotel was not a major issue to us. The front of house staff were friendly and helpful, providing us with tourism advice and arranging taxis for us, as well as printing a few documents we needed due to a change to our return flight. We used the swimming pool most days and there were rarely ever more than a few guests there, which meant it was always easy to get a sunbed. The swimming pool itself is not huge, but more than adequate for relaxing and cooling off in. I would highly recommend this hotel to families (the kitchen in the room wins major plus points) and anyone else who doesn't mind staying a little bit away from the main tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not a four star by European standards”
Reviews.Author: Harper83
Reviews.Content: The hotel manager told us that they would arrange a complimentary airport pick up but no one was there to pick us up. Then they said they instead would give us free transfer to the airport but again they let us down and we had to rush to be there in time. Beside from that the hotel staff are friendly and service minded but in Europe this would NEVER be rated as a four star hotel. A good three star but but no where neare four. The location of the hotel is good. near the Deira City Mall and Metro. The breakfast is VERY poor and a basic thing like ketchup you have to be lucky to get. The fire alarm started a couble of times. One time in the midle of the night. Luckely we already where use to it at the time so we could continue sleeping. Would i recommend this hotel? If you like us just need it as a place to sleep it's okay. If you need a little more and expect four star service, NO!.

Reviews.Title: “Quality accommodation in a secluded location”
Reviews.Author: jazk
Reviews.Content: An enjoyable stay at Star Boutique Hotel Apartment. A one-bedroom apartment was luxuriously spacious, tastefully decorated and well maintained. An ideal setting if you're seeking a discrete location away from the usual tourist hotspots. The only downside was its low profile; taxi drivers were unfamiliar with this property and required navigational assistance to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stuff , value for money ...service is excelletnt”
Reviews.Author: loulou11dubai
Reviews.Content: my 2nd visit to the hotel, the stuff is friendly , the service is excellent you can feel the difference ......clean big one bedroom apt. with creek view //// breakfast is excellent .... i enjoyed my stay ...............

Reviews.Title: “HUGELY DISAPPOINTED - TRY DUSIT PRINCESS DUBAI, ITS BETTER AND COMES WITH FREE INTERNET”
Reviews.Author: Bunnies2405
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I've gotten back to Star Boutique. The 1st time, in Nov'09 was impressive. The 2nd time was a little disappointed with the overall service. Room was not cleaned even when I get back to the room.. etc. The 3rd time, was really bad. They don't even give any perks to returning customers. Again, I left my room at ard 10am, hang out the 'Pls Clean My Room' sign, press the 'Room Cleaning Button' and when I got back at 3.30pm, the room is still not cleaned !!!! And the reception told me that I shld hv informed the reception that I wanted the room to be cleaned when I left the hotel !!! So I gathered the entire morning, none of the housekeeping staff was on my floor cleaning the rooms ! And this is NOT THE FIRST TIME !! And when I need to extend my stay, they offer me a very unattractive rate. Now bear in mind that internet doesn't come free ! But blessing in disguised, I found DUSIT PRINCESS DUBAI, near CITY CENTRE offering an even BETTER RATE, with FREE internet and 50% off F&B thrown in !! So here I am now, in a MUCH BETTER HOTEL, with BETTER SERVICE, and FREE Internet. In times like this, SERVICE is all that matters ! And remember to treat loyal customers well :)

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT - "IT" IS A HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: buddy19
Reviews.Content: Over all a very comfortable stay withvery good staff and service. Excellent location near to Metro diera station and walking distance to city center mall - kids enjoyed the spacious apartment rooms and swimming pool. Would highly recommend this hotel to everyone travelling to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home”
Reviews.Author: LovemyJY2
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay & totally value for money. I really can't fault it with the price I paid; it has far exceeded my expectation. Spacious living room, quality bed (though a bit small), fully equipped kitchen - freezer, microwave, toaster, dish washer, washing machine & other quality kitchenware...everything is in good condition and well organized in cabinet. The toilet is big & clean with two toilet bowls....this is something unusual to me. They also provide a weighing machine in the toilet! We booked the apartment thru booking.com at AED350, after reading good review from travelers and for its price. Due to tight schedule, we only managed to check in to the hotel at mid night 2am. I was so tired and could hardly open my eyes, until I entered into the apartment. It is really surprised to see the beautiful setting in the apartment! I double checked with my husband if he got us in to the right room as it seems too good for the price we paid! ( & both of us regret for checking in to the apartment too late.) Although there is a construction side right next to us, we didn't hear anything noise (maybe due to the construction was stop for UAE National day). We wake up late the next day and were so excited to see the wonderful scenery - the Burj Dubai & Dubai Creek was in front of us! Never expected it (and didn't notice it at night)! We were not aware of the time till we miss the breakfast (it is only available till 10.30am). It was around 12pm by the time we went down to lobby and were understood by the reception staff that we supposed to check out in 10mins. We asked for an extension of 2 hours for shower due to the late check-in and glad that they agreed to our request without hesitate. Thanks! Would love to recommend this apartment to all.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: calmdaisy
Reviews.Content: I travelled on a business trip and spent three days in this hotel. The staff were very friendly and the room was clean and functional. It was great to have a kitchen area with fridge freezer and microwave. The breakfast and room service were both good. I also used the swimming pool, which was very clean and had a member of staff on hand so also felt well looked after. As a woman travelling alone I felt very safe while staying in the hotel as it had more of a feeling of an apartment block.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Yayavar37
Reviews.Content: The place was very comfortable. I stayed with my wife for 4 days. Large studio apartment, very clean , well furnished unobtrusive service. Very good breakfast spread. Good location. Walking distance to Metro station and city centre mall. Excellent value for money. Only one caution book a taxi in advance during peak hours. Recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious, clean and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bodgo
Reviews.Content: Thankyou for a very enjoyable stay. The apartment was spacious, clean and comfortable. The location was good and close to the amenities we required.

Reviews.Title: “OUR HOME AT DUBAI”
Reviews.Author: MLJAIN
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay . No disturbance at all. proper responce. COOPERATIVE STAFF WITH SMILE. My family members (3) want to stay there for months . THANKS.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: ShayneDubai
Reviews.Content: Our family experienced staying in Star boutique was remarkable; it was spacious 2 +1 bedroom with huge living room and complete amenities kitchenette. The color combination is just right yellow and dark brown looks classy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at its best”
Reviews.Author: C0rle0ne84
Reviews.Content: I found the facility to be comfortable and significant in terms of locaiton. good service as well. Its near the city center and rite next to the Maktoum bridge which makes it easier to go towards Abu dhabi. I like the view form the pool side, which was my favourite spot, very relaxing and a perfect place to have evening tea ans a smoke at. The staff was very supportive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Place to Stay at!”
Reviews.Author: YMGMumbai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, very close to the Dubai City Centre, which is a walking distance from here. I booked a double room with breakfast. The room was very nice. I am particular about the washroom and this hotel has a very good, spacious, well lit washroom. The staff at their restaurant is very helpful. The pool facility is average and so is the gym and steam/sauna facility. They need to replace their Gym Manager right away. Not at all co-operative and it took him half an hour to provide us with a soap/shower gel, and in the end it turned out to be a shampoo tube! Also the concierge are not very friendly, and they dampen the overall experience of the stay. The room service is good, and quick. It is a little tricky to reach this hotel, and the cab drivers too are not much aware how to reach there, Its right in front of Clock Tower,yet so away! Overall a good experience, the proximity to some of Dubai's Best shopping places is the best + point.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: usconcepts
Reviews.Content: While the front desk may smile, they are greedy and absolutely useless. I stayed for a week, and purchased a $6 (one hour) internet card one evening, and it worked for two hours, and then stopped working. After 4 representatives, including the manager, they did not want to credit me for the $6 card. I was with a group of 20+ and we were spending 18thousand upward for our stay, and they refused to credit me for the smallest of items. But they did continue to smile through the whole process. The room cleaning was very bad. The room was never cleaned until about 4 or 5pm and always below standard. The location is crummy, far away from everything, and next to impossible to get a taxi. Stay away from this hotel if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: propmill
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just one night but would have happily stayed much longer. Check-in at 2:00am was fast and efficient and I found the staff to be very helpfut. The hotel is owned by the developer ETA Star, so if their hotel is indicative of the standard of their real estate developments, that bodes well for people buying apartments in Dubai. The hotel opened in May 2007. The room was very modern and tastefully done. It was a fully equipped studio with very high ceilings and probably the best bathroom I've had in a hotel ever. The kitchenette looked to be superbly equipped, although I didn't stay long enough to use the facilities. Toiletries in the bathroom were again excellent and more wide-ranging (disposable toothbrush etc) than any other hotel I've stayed in - and as we usually stay 4 or 5 star that's saying something. My room overlooked the construction site, but noise levels were minimal. What I really liked were blackout curtains behind the main curtains so I slept until late. Breakfast was only AED45 and again was a good spread in a tasteful restaurant. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: dandeja
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor member, Key West, Florida I stayed in the Star Boutique on business from the 7th to the 12th of December 2007. The hotel is very nice and at the clocktower intersection, is close to a lot of things in Dubai (my case the courthouse). Views from the apartment bacloneys of Dubai Creek are nice. What was very strange and frustrating was that their key system apparently did not work. I had to get a bell person to open the door each time I came and went. The staff seem to be professional and trained well, but are a bit inflexible on most things - not really wanting to accomodate guests. They are friendly enough, but I never really got that warm feeling I like to have when traveling so far from home. Don't think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning rooms with terrible service”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnob1
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Good location for sight seeing but will need an inexpensive taxi (usually US$5 to US$10 dollars to most places . All hotels will require a taxi to other malls or sites so it’s best to be by a beach or mall. 5 minute walk to Deira city center mall that has all the comforts of home (food, clothing, upscale restaurants, food court, etc.). Definitely feels like you are staying in a commercial park with tall buildings all around, but I think that is the way most of Dubai feels. BED/SHEETS/PILLOW: Extremely comfortable bed with high quality linens. Pillows were way too thick, but thinner, down pillows are available on request. LIGHTING: Just a tad too dark in the bedrooms and the hallways are way too dark. Bathroom lighting was excellent. BATHROOM/SHOWER: Absolutely stunning. This will impress even the most seasoned and discriminating traveler. It will be one of the nicest bathroom you’ve ever seen. Very masculine décor and color. Great water pressure and consistent water temperature (be sure to flip the switch on the wall for the water heater). Only complaint is they use a shower curtain. TOILETRIES: Great. Probably the kind you want to take home. CLEANLINESS: The entire room, hotel, and bathroom was spotless. A/C: Just a tad louder than we would have preferred, but very effective in cooling the room quickly. CLOSET SPACE: Tons of space for 2 to unpack everything. STYLE OF ROOM: Stunning. The room is absolutely gorgeous. We were blown away, especially with the one bedroom vs. studio. Both rooms have washer/dryer, burners, microwave, toaster, and larger than normal refrigerator for a hotel room. QUIET/LIGHT: The room was very quiet even though construction is right outside the hotel, like nearly all hotels in Dubai. Lighting in the bedroom and bathroom was great. FOOD: Only had cereal. They have a breakfast buffet with some meats and cereals, but you can pay a la carte. There is also an ice cream cart in the lobby that also has muffins and croissants. A one minute walk away is a convenience store to load up on food to cook in your room or put in the refrigerator. TV/INTERNET: Flat screen TV was of good size but just a little too far from the bed (in the studio, and from the couch in the 1 bedroom). Wired and wireless internet is available in the rooms for US$5 for one hour of continuous use of US$27 for 24 hours of continuous use. You can not log out and save minutes for later consumption. The internet here is way too expensive. We were told they were going to allow guests to log out and save their minutes for later. There is also a computer for guest use in the lobby with the same charges. SERVICE: This is the area that makes this hotel terrible. Some requests would only be made after several calls. Sometimes when calling reception, the phone would ring 10 times before an answer. We were charged for 2 days of breakfast when we only ate their one day. They had a signed bill from someone else, clearly different from mine and it was a very long process to get it removed, as if they didn’t believe me. The staff is very nice but very incompetent and powerless. Even the managers have absolutely no power. Our washing machine broke the morning we left and we left the hotel carrying wet clothes, had an extra charge on our bill on our breakfast, and all the management said is they will take care of us next time. I asked how, and he said he will make us happy. I cancelled our already booked room for 3 days later right in front of the manager and he did nothing. Too much detail here but this is a major issue with this hotel. The concierge here was a former tour guide and is excellent and helping plan your trip, I strongly encourage meeting with him when you arrive. COMMON AREA: The lobby is nice but does not reflect the incredible rooms above. The pool is very clean and is surprising staffed to provide towels and drinks. Hallways to the rooms were way too dark. Hotel has a hip “W”-ish style to it. TIPS: It was great buying popcorn at the convenience store and being able to make it in the room with the microwave and watch movies. If you can live with the incompetent staff, you will be very impressed by the rooms. The one bedroom option here could be in the fanciest hotel in the US and you will still be impressed. If you can afford the upgrade, definitely book it. Please check my other hotels listed in case you are nervous about there only being one review on tripadvisor. If the service was better this would be a 5* review.

HotelInfo.Name: Star Boutique Hotel Apartment
HotelInfo.Address: PO BOX 181689, Dubai 15308, United Arab Emirates
